site_name: Flats 1-7 (Inc) At 5 Freeland Road And Flats 1-7 (Inc) At 9 Freeland Road
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of five years from the date of the original permission (02210/2).

REASON: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Drawing Nos. 8807/516/4, 5, 6 to the satisfaction of the local planning authority.

REASON: To ensure that the development is carried out as approved by the local planning authority. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building to the satisfaction of the local planning authority.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonize with the surroundings. | Refuse bin stores in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be provided and thereafter retained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.
REASON: To ensure adequate provision for refuse storage is made within the site. | Landscaping for the front garden shall be in accordance with the hereby approved 02210/DL dated 11 July 1990.

REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority in the interests of the visual amenity of the area. | The development hereby approved shall be used by a Registered Housing Association only and shall not be used by any other person or company without the prior written permission of the local planning authority, provided that this condition shall not be binding on a mortgagee or chargee  (or any receiver (including an administrative receiver) appointed by such mortgagee or chargee or any other person appointed under any security documentation to enable such mortgagee or chargee to realise its security or any administrator (howsoever appointed) including a housing administrator (each a Receiver)) of the whole or any part of the development or any persons or bodies deriving title through such mortgagee or chargee or Receiver.

REASON: Permission has only been granted due to the personal circumstances of the applicant and would not otherwise be appropriate, in accordance with Policy H13 of the London Plan (2021). | The premises (Nos. 5 and 9 Freeland Road) shall be used as flats for elderly people and for no other purpose without the prior written permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application, provided that the provisions of this condition shall not be binding on a mortgagee or chargee  (or any receiver (including an administrative receiver) appointed by such mortgagee or chargee or any other person appointed under any security documentation to enable such mortgagee or chargee to realise its security or any administrator (howsoever appointed) including a housing administrator (each a Receiver)) of the whole or any part of the premises or any persons or bodies deriving title through such mortgagee or chargee or Receiver.

REASON: To comply with the terms of the application as submitted and to enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the amenity of the locality with particular regard to the availability of off street car parking facilities, in accordance with Policies D6 and T6 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Wheelchair access to the ground floor of the buildings shall be provided and thereafter retained to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To comply with the Council's policies for people with disabilities. | The existing trees on the site shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees without the prior written permission of the local planning authority.
REASON: To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual amenity of the area.
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary conditions no.6 (personal to ASRA/or Registered Housing Association) and no.7 ( restrict use), seeking to incorporate an acceptable mortgagee exclusion clause in pursuant to planning permission reference 02210/2 dated  21/12/1989 for' Conversion of home for the elderly into twenty self-contained units for elderly and family use (including physically handicapped), extensions to roof to include front gables at nos. 5 and 7, front dormer at 9, rear gables and dormers at nos. 5,7 and 9 and new windows to rear and side elevations.'
